A little bit about Damascus steel

Damascus steels are made by forge-welding two or more different metals (usually steels). The billets are heated and welded together. Then folded and the same process is done until the maker is satisfied with the amount of layers usually between 352 & 512  layers depending on the maker. The Damascus is then acid-etched. The different metals etch at different rates, and depth and color contrast are revealed.


There are some tips for you to look after your knives
•	Never store your knives for long periods in the leather sheath. Leather can absorb water, which will rust the knife.

•	After use, wash the blade, dry it, and use Flitz, WD-40, vegetable oil, or Vaseline, Gun oil on the blade to prevent rust. 

•	Johnson’s paste wax can be used on the blade handle and sheath to protect it.  Birchwood Casey gunstock wax is another alternative for the sheath.


•	If your sheath gets wet, don’t store the knife in it.


•	These Sheaths are made of fresh Cowhide Leather. So always coat your knife with WD-40, vegetable oil, or Vaseline, Gun oil on the blade to prevent rust. For the first couple months. To give the leather time to age and release any moisture from the tanning process.

The combination of great wear resistance, almost-stainlessness, and good toughness make it a great choice for a number of machete & knife styles.

A Lot of the knives you see on the net are “Wall hanger s” or “Decoration pieces!” That’s why they are so cheap, they just try to make them look “COOL” or “Deadly” But they are more deadly to the owner because they will not hold up. But when and if you need it, you can trust that it will do the unexpected if need be! You can Stake your life on it and know it won’t let you down in any why! 

D2 STEEL

D2 is sometimes called a "semi-stainless". It has fairly high chrome content (12%), but not high enough to classify it as stainless. It is more stain resistant than the carbon steels however, it has excellent wear resistance. D2 is much tougher than the premium stainless steels like ATS-34, but not as tough as many of the other non-stainless steels. The combination of great wear resistance, almost-stainlessness, and good toughness make it a great choice for a number of machete & knife styles. 


There are some tips for you to look after your knives
•	Never store your knives for long periods in the leather sheath. Leather can absorb water, which will rust the knife.

•	After use, wash the blade, dry it, and use Flitz, WD-40, vegetable oil, or Vaseline, Gun oil on the blade to prevent rust. 

•	Johnson’s paste wax can be used on the blade handle and sheath to protect it.  Birchwood Casey gunstock wax is another alternative for the sheath.


•	If your sheath gets wet, don’t store the knife in it.


•	These Sheaths are made of fresh Cowhide Leather. So always coat your knife with WD-40, vegetable oil, or Vaseline, Gun oil on the blade to prevent rust. For the first couple months. To give the leather time to age and release any moisture from the tanning process.

postcontent:
#16- CUSTOM HAND MADE “DAMASCUS”- TANTO STYLE -HUNTING & FIGHTING KNIVES!

DESCRIPTION

BLADE

The 1/4” Damascus blade is made with 1084 steel and 15N20 Steel - 512 LAYERS
Hand forged to Beautiful Damascus steel Pattern.
Hardness of blades will be 56 to 59 HRC
Hand sharpened to an Extremely Sharp Edge. 


 SHEATH  

Includes: Heavy Duty Cowhide Leather Sheath with Belt Loop 

BE CAREFULL!

A Lot of the knives you see on the net are “Wall hanger s” or “Decoration pieces!” That’s why they are so cheap, they just try to make them look “COOL” or “Deadly” But they are more deadly to the owner because they will not hold up. I believe, that if I own any knife or machete it has to be a fully functioning workhorse or why would want it. It would be like having a gun with no bullets -WHAT GOOD IS IT! I should just put a poster on the wall! My items are for everyday use if needed “BUT” nice enough to put on the wall and show them off if you want to! But when and if you need it, you can trust that it will do the unexpected if need be! You can Stake your life on it and know it won’t let you down in any why! 

A little bit about Damascus steel

Damascus steels are made by forge-welding two or more different metals (usually steels). The billets are heated and welded together. Then folded and the same process is done until the maker is satisfied with the amount of layers usually between 352 & 512  layers depending on the maker. The Damascus is then acid-etched. The different metals etch at different rates, and depth and color contrast are revealed.


There are some tips for you to look after your knives
•	Never store your knives for long periods in the leather sheath. Leather can absorb water, which will rust the knife.

•	After use, wash the blade, dry it, and use Flitz, WD-40, vegetable oil, or Vaseline, Gun oil on the blade to prevent rust. 

•	Johnson’s paste wax can be used on the blade handle and sheath to protect it.  Birchwood Casey gunstock wax is another alternative for the sheath.


•	If your sheath gets wet, don’t store the knife in it.


•	These Sheaths are made of fresh Cowhide Leather. So always coat your knife with WD-40, vegetable oil, or Vaseline, Gun oil on the blade to prevent rust. For the first couple months. To give the leather time to age and release any moisture from the tanning process.

postcontent:
CUSTOM HAND MADE DAMASCUS –SPEACIAL EDITION- DAMASCUS STEEL THE BOOK OF ELI - FULL TANG MACHETE – This is the Most Accurate One I have Seen! And As Close As you Can Get To the REAL ONE THAT - DENZEL WASHINGTON (ELI) Used in The Movie.

NOTE: THESE ARE HAND MADE I ONLY HAVE 4 LEFT OUT OF 10 
I WILL DROP THIS ADD IF SOLD LOCALLY BEFORE ANY BIDS.


DESCRIPTION

MEASUREMENTS

Overall Length = 27.00 Inches

Blade Length = 20.00 Inches

Handle Length = 07.00 Inches

Blade Thickness = 1/4” FULL TANG DAMASCUS STEEL

Includes: Heavy Duty Leather Sheath 


BLADE

BLADE: HAS A VERY SHARP EDGE!
The  ¼” Damascus blade is made with 1084 steel and 15N20 Steel 
Hand forged to Beautiful Damascus steel Pattern.
Hardness of blades will be 56 to 59 HRC
Hand sharpened to an Extremely Sharp Edge. 
Blade Has Five Holes same as the one used in the movie! See Movie Pictures! 

 SHEATH  

Includes: Heavy Duty Leather Sheath with Belt Loop and (3) Loops on the back of the Sheath so you can use on your waist or shoulder (Included a 64” Belt that can be used as a Shoulder Strap)


BE CAREFULL!

Most of these machetes you see on the net are made as a Stainless Steel “Wall hanger s” or “Decoration pieces!” I believe, that if I own any knife or machete it has to be a fully functioning workhorse or why would want it. It would be like having a gun with no bullets -WHAT GOOD IS IT! I should just put a poster on the wall! My items are for everyday use if needed “BUT” nice enough to put on the wall and show them off! But when and if you need it, you  can trust that it will do the unexpected if need be! You can Stake your life on it and know you’ll still be alive if you do!


Watch Out For The Con Artist Companies Out To Make A Buck!

So many places tried to adapt what they already made or had in stock to simulate and just plain out lie that it was the same as in the movie. One of the biggest misnomers I have found is that everyone now thinks the center hole on the blade is larger! It is not – Look at the movie pictures they are all the same size! Once again trying to use what they already had in stock. The handle was not just a thin layer of leather, it was thick. Mine has wood base then leather wrapped and fits very comfortable in your hand.  Last but not least you get what you pay for. If you buy a $30 machete because “it’s Cool Looking” just remember how cool looking it was before it broke when you needed it most. And when it lets you down I hope and pray that your Life doesn’t depend on your cheap “Wall Hanger!”


A little bit about Damascus steel

Damascus steels are made by forge-welding two or more different metals (usually steels). The billets are heated and welded together. Then folded and the same process is done until the maker is satisfied with the amount of layers usually between 352 & 512  layers depending on the maker. The Damascus is then acid-etched. The different metals etch at different rates, and depth and color contrast are revealed.

Damascus can be made with performance and/or aesthetic objectives in mind. Aesthetically, the choice of materials is important. One shiny steel and one darker steel etch out to show the most striking pattern. If the maker is going more for beauty than performance, he might even go with nickel, which is bright but does not perform as well as steel for cutlery applications. The other factor affecting beauty is of course the welding pattern. 

The following steels will provide bright lines:
1.) 15N20 -- nickel content   
The following steels will provide dark lines:
2.) 1084

Damascus and Carbon Steel knives do require some extra care.
There are some tips for you to look after your knives
•	Never store your knives for long periods in the leather sheath. Leather can absorb water, which will rust the knife.

•	After use, wash the blade, dry it, and use Flitz, WD-40, vegetable oil, or Vaseline, Gun oil on the blade to prevent rust. 

•	Johnson’s paste wax can be used on the blade handle and sheath to protect it.  Birchwood Casey gunstock wax is another alternative for the sheath.


•	Damascus is very easy to clean up if rusted but seems to be rust resistant. Sometimes Damascus gets dark with age. To brighten up the blade, sand it lengthwise with a worn piece of 600 grit sand paper. This just hits the raised portions of the etched pattern and makes the blade look brighter.

•	If your sheath gets wet, don’t store the knife in it.

title: For Sale:  BOOK OF ELI - FULL TANG MACHETE CUSTOM HAND MADE “D2”- STEEL
postcontent:
CUSTOM HAND MADE “D2”- STEEL THE BOOK OF ELI - FULL TANG MACHETE – This is the Most Accurate One I have Seen! And As Close As you Can Get To the REAL ONE THAT - DENZEL WASHINGTON (ELI) Used in The Movie. 

DESCRIPTION

MEASUREMENTS

Overall Length = 27.00 Inches

Blade Length = 20.00 Inches

Handle Length = 07.00 Inches

Blade Thickness = 1/4” FULL TANG D2-STEEL

Includes: Heavy Duty Leather Sheath 


BLADE

BLADE: HAS A VERY SHARP EDGE!
The 1/4” D2 STEEL

Hardness of blades will be 56 to 59 HRC
Hand sharpened to an Extremely Sharp Edge. 

Blade Has Five Holes same as the one used in the movie! See Movie Pictures! 

 SHEATH  

Includes: Heavy Duty Leather Sheath with Belt Loop and (3) Loops on the back of the Sheath so you can use on your waist or shoulder (Included a 64” Belt that can be used as a Shoulder Strap)


BE CAREFULL!

Most of these machetes you see on the net are “Wall hanger s” or “Decoration pieces!” I believe, that if I own any knife or machete it has to be a fully functioning workhorse or why would want it. It would be like having a gun with no bullets -WHAT GOOD IS IT! I should just put a poster on the wall! My items are for everyday use if needed “BUT” nice enough to put on the wall and show them off! But when and if you need it, you can trust that it will do the unexpected if need be! You can Stake your life on it and know you’ll still be alive if you do!


Watch Out For The Con Artist Companies Out To Make A Buck!

So many places tried to adapt what they already made or had in stock to simulate and just plain out lie that it was the same as in the movie. One of the biggest misnomers I have found is that everyone now thinks the center hole on the blade is larger! It is not – Look at the movie pictures they are all the same size! Once again trying to use what they already had in stock. The handle was not just a thin layer of leather, it was thick. Mine has wood base then leather wrapped and fits very comfortable in your hand.  Last but not least you get what you pay for. If you buy a $30 machete because “it’s Cool Looking” just remember how cool looking it was before it broke when you needed it most. And when it lets you down I hope and pray that your Life doesn’t depend on your cheap “Wall Hanger!”


D2 STEEL

D2 is sometimes called a "semi-stainless". It has fairly high chrome content (12%), but not high enough to classify it as stainless. It is more stain resistant than the carbon steels mentioned above, however. It has excellent wear resistance. D2 is much tougher than the premium stainless steels like ATS-34, but not as tough as many of the other non-stainless steels mentioned here. The combination of great wear resistance, almost-stainlessness, and good toughness make it a great choice for a number of machete & knife styles. Bob Dozier is one maker who uses D2-steel. Benchmade Company has begun using D2 in its Axis AFCK also.


There are some tips for you to look after your knives
•	Never store your knives for long periods in the leather sheath. Leather can absorb water, which will rust the knife.

•	After use, wash the blade, dry it, and use Flitz, WD-40, vegetable oil, or Vaseline, Gun oil on the blade to prevent rust. 

•	Johnson’s paste wax can be used on the blade handle and sheath to protect it.  Birchwood Casey gunstock wax is another alternative for the sheath.


•	Damascus is very easy to clean up if rusted but seems to be rust resistant. Sometimes Damascus gets dark with age. To brighten up the blade, sand it lengthwise with a worn piece of 600 grit sand paper. This just hits the raised portions of the etched pattern and makes the blade look brighter.

•	If your sheath gets wet, don’t store the knife in it.

title: For Sale:  **USA made**  3 Point CQB 1 1/4 inch sling HK91, PTR91, Cetme
postcontent:
I've got some USA made 3 point slings for HK 91, PTR 91 and CETME rifles with the fixed butt stock and mid mount sling loop in the stock. They may fit a HK 93 also, but I don't have one to test fit with. The pics are with my CETME upgraded with the HK rear stock

The slings go over your head and one shoulder for 3 point carry and hands free positioning across your chest. They also work in normal 2 point shoulder carry for African or American carry. These slings are heavy duty 1.25 inch wide mil-spec Cordura nylon and are perfect for the weight of the rifle without being bulky. 

Available in Black and OD green at this time with Marapat Coyote coming soon. 

If you like the tactical functionality or just the tacti-cool aspect these are awesome slings. I've had a 3 point for a few years and love it! 

And remember... a rifle without a sling is like a handgun without a holster!



Features:

The slings are 1.25 inch wide Mil Spec 55301 Cordura nylon strap material.

Front mounting is the sturdy HK style snap clip. Attaches to the OEM side mounted eyelet on the triple tree.

The rear mounting routes the main strap of the sling through the pin/slot in the butt stock. **Installation of this sling requires unthreading the rear buckle, routing the strap through the stock and then rethreading the strap and buckle.**

Both colors have black plastic buckles. See my other ad's for more sling models to fit your other favorite rifles

100% American made!

Please be aware, installation of this sling requires unthreading the rear buckle, routing the strap through the stock and then rethreading the strap and buckle. It will come assembled. I will include instructions, but know that there is some disassembly/reassembly work required. Adding any kind of quick release at the rear interferes with a good cheek weld and this was the best option for a quality fit.

If you buy one and like it please give me a positive feedback and I will return the favor.

Thanks for looking!! Let me know if you have any questions.

(sling for sale only, rifle for demonstration only)

A Lot of the knives you see on the net are “Wall hanger s” or “Decoration pieces!” That’s why they are so cheap, they just try to make them look “COOL” or “Deadly” But they are more deadly to the owner because they will not hold up. A little bit about Damascus steel

Damascus steels are made by forge-welding two or more different metals (usually steels). The billets are heated and welded together. Then folded and the same process is done until the maker is satisfied with the amount of layers usually between 352 & 512  layers depending on the maker. The Damascus is then acid-etched. The different metals etch at different rates, and depth and color contrast are revealed.


There are some tips for you to look after your knives
•	Never store your knives for long periods in the leather sheath. Leather can absorb water, which will rust the knife.

•	After use, wash the blade, dry it, and use Flitz, WD-40, vegetable oil, or Vaseline, Gun oil on the blade to prevent rust.

5.56 NATO (223 Remington), 16 in, 6 Point Collapsible Stock, Black Finish, 30 Round Detachable Magazine

This rifle was built for the price conscious user who is looking for a good quality and inexpensive AR15 style rifle for range practice and/or home defense. They were able to do so by changing some features that should NOT upset the majority of target shooting users out there. The barrel used is made in house – 16″ without m203 cuts, melanite coated inside and out, 1:8 twist rate, and 5R rifled. The 5R rifled barrel designs have been in use by Thompson Center, a S&W owned company, for a long time in order to produce an inexpensive and very accurate product. Those looking for a milspec rifle, this isn’t the one for you, but melanite has proven itself a durable, corrosion resistant, uniform coating that can be considered more accurate than chrome lining. Other differences on the Sport models include: an upper receiver lacking a dusk cover and forward assist, a lower receiver with integral enhanced trigger guard, LMT style removable rear sight and A2 style front sight, chromed gas key and bolt carrier and other standard A2 styled parts. title: For Sale:  Interarms/Norinco clone of Browning SA22 Takedown 22lr rifle
postcontent:
!!! If this ad is still active the gun is for sale.  I will not respond to "is this gun still available" emails !!!

This is a copy of the famous (and expensive) Browning SA.22 takedown semi auto rifle.  It is made by Interarms and is very well made, very reliable, and very accurate.  It breaks down in seconds without any tools and reassembles just as easily.  Broken down each piece is roughly 18” so it’s a perfect backpack or camping rifle that’s fully capable of getting the job done.  It only shoots 22lr (not 22 shorts or 22 magnums).

This rifle is NIB (New In Box) and is therefore in absolutely perfect condition.  I have 2 of these and decided to let one go.

These rifles have nice checkering on the stock and forearm with a high gloss finish and the bluing is quite nice too.  There is some light scroll work on each side of the receiver (sorry my picture is a bit blurry).

You load this gun through a loading tube in the stock (hold 11) and it ejects the empties out the bottom of the receiver. These were only imported by Interarms for a short period in the 80’s.

Not looking for trades.  FTF in Greensboro.  All laws will be followed and you'll need to sign a bill of sale.

title: For Sale:  Bulgaran SLR-95 by Arsenal AK AK47
postcontent: The Bulgarian SLR-95 is a milled AK variant that was imported in to the United States from 1994 to 1998. It is a post ban version of the AK produced by Arsenal of Bulgaria. The Bulgarian SLR-95 comes with a synthetic sporter style stock, five round magazine, and 3 30rd magazines. Two versions of the rifle were imported one with a muzzle brake pinned to the barrel and one without (mine has muzzle break). The finish of the gun is flat black paint. rifle has a Steyr-manufactured chrome-lined barrel, milled receiver, and is much higher quality than the US-built AKs that are put together with US receivers and surplus parts kits. This rifle has all matching numbers...the bolt, bolt-carrier, and dust cover all match the weapon's serial number. This is the most accurate & reliable AK47 ever made hands down. price ranges from 800-1500. Mines in great condition and is well worth the 1000.00. I also have sealed russion FMJ 960 rds 7.62x39 for $225.00 call or text 602-881-59 (one)-zero no blocked calls answered

title: For Sale:  LWRC M6A2 16" Upgraded Gas Piston Rifle NIB 5.56/.223
postcontent:
Buy with confidence from a AUTHORIZED LWRC DEALER! This Upgraded M6A2 rifle is new in the box and comes with everything standard from the factory! Upgraded rifles come with the SOPMOD stock (vs. a standard M4 on a basic), a Magpul MAID grip (vs. a standard A2 on a basic), and LWRC aluminum flip up iron sites (vs polymer ARMS flip-ups on a basic).

Caliber: 5.56 NATO
Barrel Length: 16.1"
Weight (unloaded): 7.3 lbs (16.1" barrel)
Length (overall): 33.3" - 36.5" (16.1" barrel)
Rate of Fire: Semi-Auto 
Rifling: 1/7" RH (5.56)
Stock/Pistol Grip: B5 Systems SOPMOD/Magpul MIAD
Sights: LWRCI Folding BUIS Front and Rear
Magazine: Magpul 30 rd. P-Mag (5.56)
Muzzle Device: A2 Birdcage 1/2x28 TPI (5.56)

The M6A2™ rifle is a standard carbine available in various barrel lengths in 5.56mm NATO. The M6A2™ rifle is ideal for those who utilize optical sights as it employs a low- profile gas block. There is no A-frame front sight to obscure the field of view of the optical device. The M6A2™ rifle also features a longer midlength free float rail system with a removable return-to-zero top. Any M4 MIL Std 1913 accessory can be mounted to the rail, and because the rail has a monolithic profile, you can bridge devices from the receiver to the rail seamlessly. The longer rail also affords more 1913 “real estate” to mount your accessories.

I will ship this gun to any FFL in any state where this firearm is legal to own. If you need a shipping quote please email me the zip code (or as close as possible) that the gun will be shipped to. Payments can be made by money order, certified check, personal check (gun will be held until check clears for orders shipped out of state), or cash.


Note: The Pictures show Basic AND Upgraded Models. This listing is for a UPGRADED model only. In the picture with two rifles, the UPGRADED model is the one on Bottom.

title: For Sale:  ***Reduced***50 BMG Sniper Rifle
location: South Mills NC, Hampton Roads, Virginia
postcontent: I have a 50 BMG sniper rifle with a bull barrel. Rifle barrel is made by Walther Lother, which is a german made. Lower on rifle is a grizzly lower and has noveske internal. Buttstock on rifle is a ACE skeletal.  Rifle is tight and true and has been proven to shoot through 2 inches of steel like it was butter. Rifle has only had 10 rounds down the pipe.This rifle is for serious shooters. Barrel has been hand Lapped as well as been through a Kryo process. Lapping is a process where a gunsmith pours Lead lap into the bore and with abrasive paste and works from end to end finding tight spots and laps them smooth, this process increases accuracy of rifle. Kyro process is where they Kryogenically freeze the barrel and bring it back to room temperature slowly this process increases the strenth of the barrel and also increases its accuracy as well. Both of these processes cost me an additional $700.00 and is almost impossible to find smiths that will even attempt this work. I have reduced the sale price on the rifle and looking to make a quick sale on the rifle to fund my new rifle coming in. No trades accepted at this time. If you have any questions please text them to me at REDACTED.

postcontent:
HOWA AXIOM M-1500.223
Kings Desert Shadow Dipped Camo
10 round detachable magazine
bi-pod
custom muzzle break
adjustable buttstock

The Howa/Axiom uses a cam and spring absorber in the pistol grip and another heavy spring in the stock tube. Both systems are separate units from the forend, allowing the stock to absorb recoil on impact. The Howa M-1500 offers as standard many features found in much more expensive rifles, like a forged receiver and forged, one-piece bolt that are both ported for safety, a three position safety. The bolt also features two locking lugs and an M-16 style extractor.

Specifications and features:
Howa/Axiom Heavy Barrel Varminter bolt action rifle
.223 Remington caliber
24" heavy barrel
10 + 1 round capacity
Knoxx Axiom V/S adjustable rifle stock
Rugged lightweight synthetic stock
Instantly adjustable length-of-pull from 11.5" to 15.5"
Two recoil suppression devices for maximum recoil reduction of up to 70%
Completely free-floated barrel for maximum accuracy
CNC milled to specifically fit the Howa M-1500 action
42.25" to 45" overall length
Desert camouflage finish
11.8 lbs

These rifles are ideal for bench rest shooting or varmint and predator hunting.

This Howa/Axiom in a heavy barrel varmint version features a Camo Nikko Stirling 4-16x44 Nighteater scope, 24" heavy (#6 taper) barrel for greater heat dissipation and stability, and a Black synthetic stock.

The Nighteater Series features riflescopes with Grade A lenses coated with the exclusive Microlux? ETE coatings developed to improve light transfer to the eyes for low-light shooting. Models include saddle parallax adjustment from 10m to infinity and stylish "built-in" sunshades. Nighteater scopes were the 2007 NRA Golden Bullseye award winner for optics.

title: For Sale/Trade:  CIVIL WAR .58 CONVERTED TO REMINGTON ROLLING BLOCK. RARE ITEM
postcontent:
From the Great Grandson of a Civil War veteran who served with the Confederacy (I also got a signed letter from the Great Grand son to this effect along with his Great Grand fathers name so he may be located by Civil War historians). May trade for old farm tractor.

The story that has been passed down is that his Great Grandfather carried this actual gun in the Civil War and still bears the carvings of the Confederate Company he served in"A" Company, as well as a cross for his faith.From the patina of the metal, burn marks on the stock and the fact that every mark or stamp that was ever on this rifle is totally worn off attests to the fact that rifle served this family faithfully for a long time through very rough circumstances before it was retired to family heirloom status (Great Grandson.says he has shot it though).

Since the date for a standard Remington R.B. did not match the Civil War time frame exactly my initial thoughts were that this rifle was an early production Rolling Block but I later found that the 15 to 20,000 rolling blocks issued to Union troops during the Civil War time frame were of a split breech design which this rifle is not.

I was not ready to give up though because the previous owner was 110% sure this rifle was carried by his Great Grandfather in the Civil War so a local Remington collector, who was kind enough to assist with his considerable knowledge assisted and we explored the only other option which would explain this mystery. 

After the Civil War some soldiers who survived took their original .58 caliber muskets and had them professionally converted by Remington into the fast loading and desirable Remington Rolling Blocks. By doing it this way they still retained the muskets original .58 caliber barrel ,sights, forearm and stock! It also saved them money of course. So I was instructed to get bore measurements since this would be the only way to support the family claims all these years.

When I measured the breech it initially came out to .50 cal and my heart fell, BUT after my insistence that I believed the Great Grandson did not make this up the local collector asked me to look for a sleeve that Remington would have installed into the Civil War musket modifying it from the original .58 caliber down to the cartridge type .50-70 it currently is.

I looked and YES, there is a sleeve. I got out the digital calipers and the outside diameter of the sleeve on this rifle is in fact the .58 

In light of that information that would explain why the Great Grandfather was able to say this WAS the rifle he carried in the Civil War. While at that time it was not equipped with the Rolling Block mechanism everything else including his carvings of the stock identifying his company and the cross appear to be all correct making this a very rare rifle that saw duty in the Civil War and was professionally converted by Remington while still retaining the personalization and history of the Civil War soldier who carried it.

Even without this almost lost history a basic Remington Rolling Block is a valuable and heavy hitting rifle (were used later on as Buffalo Rifles and in many many battles and wars literally all over the world) and if you research our National Historic Firearms Museum in the United States the Remington Rolling block was the very first weapon to start what is now over 5000 classic firearms.

Upon his fathers death the previous gentleman inherited the rifle and his now deceased Pastor (prior to computers) who had an extensive weapons library researched the rifle for several weeks before getting back to him. Even at collector prices back then it was valued at between $800 and $1500. I have been told that this is obviously a low value number after so many years, but as they say it is worth what someone will pay for it and I will be reasonable to a serious collector.

The Great Grandson said they have fired this "cannon" and that it did very well but I have no .50 cal ammo and if I keep it I doubt I will ever fire it. I can tell you the action is very strong, tight and confident feeling and while the stock is a tad loose the rolling block mechanism operates as it was intended to over 130 years ago so if you were determined I am sure you could call it back into service once again or just admire it for the piece of American history it is.

That is where we currently are on researching the rifle until I visit another expert. I really have no interest for additional muskets trades at this time(thank you for the offers I have received on those) instead preferring some higher end modern weapons (or World War II weapons) or a reasonable cash offer.

Please read this. If you do have a reasonable trade send all of it's information along with pictures. If you have trouble sending pictures please send the written information on your trade and let me know you are having problems with sending things and we can figure that out.

Also since I am not an expert and I value any information or even corrections as I work towards getting this to a qualified collector who can display it properly and enjoy it for years to come.
